result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 6/9/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.
Referral DCPS for GPS and drug testing.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Charles Andrew Ver Hoeve.  Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In court today for a bail/bond hearing in 22CF494 and 22CF1083. Atty Ver Hoeve gives argument. State gives argument and objects to modification. Court makes findings and orders as follows:

22CF494- Cash bail is lowered to $250.00, with $100.00 previously posted to apply to this cash bail. If the DE posts bail, DE is to report to DCPS for GPS and random drug testing. All other bail conditions will remain the same. 

22CF1083- Cash bail is lowered to $300.00. If the DE posts bail, DE is to report to DCPS for GPS and random drug testing. All other bail conditions will remain the same.
